title: Alternative Hypothesis Definition
text: H_a — the alternative hypothesis: a claim about the population that is contradictory to H_0 and what we conclude when we reject H_0.

title: Finding H_a
text: If a claim is brought up against an assumption or belief about the parameter, the claim will usually be used as the alternative hypothesis. In this question, relevant information is found here: "Do the data support the claim that the mean height is less than 73 inches?"
